code: @Manual{,   title = {Sysrecon: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction},   author = {Shilin Ouyang and Zihao Li and Jiamin Hu and Miyuan Cao and Feng Yu and Longfei Mao},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://oyshilin.github.io/Sysrecon}, }

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: past decade, genome-scale metabolic reconstructions widely used comprehend systems biology metabolic pathways within organism. Different GSMs constructed using various techniques require distinct steps, input data, information conversion software tools neither concisely defined mathematically programmatically formulated context-specific manner.tool quantitatively qualitatively specifies reconstruction steps can generate template list reconstruction steps dynamically selected reconstruction step reservoir, constructed based available published papers.

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: visualize steps, databases tools used genome-scale metabolic reconstruction, need eight types data inputs - inputTxt, stepsMatrix, stepTypes, conversionMatrix, conversionTypes, toolsMatrix, toolsTypes contentTypes. inputTxt variable contains contents metabolic reconstruction article example inputTxt Sysrecon package. want analyze another article, can import article R. seven types data package data frame types. stepsMatrix contains details steps metabolic reconstruction stepTypes data frame contains labels groups stepsMatrix. conversionMatrix contains details transformation metabolic reconstruction conversionTypes contains labels groups conversionMatrix. toolsMatrix contains details databases tools metabolic reconstruction toolsTypes contains labels groups toolsMatrix. Finally, contentTypes contains labels groups contents metabolic reconstruction.
code: inputTxt = Sysrecon::inputTxt inputTxt = read.table(path, fill = T, sep = '\n', quote = "") stepsMatrix = Sysrecon::stepsMatrix stepTypes = Sysrecon::stepTypes conversionMatrix = Sysrecon::conversionMatrix conversionTypes = Sysrecon::conversionTypes toolsMatrix = Sysrecon::toolsMatrix toolsTypes = Sysrecon::toolsTypes contentTypes = Sysrecon::contentTypes

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: data needed prepared, Sysrecon package can used. generates three pictures output. three pictures visualization steps, transformation, databases tools metabolic reconstruction, respectively. output like chemical formula facilitate understanding steps elements needed step.
code: Sysrecon(inputTxt, stepsMatrix, stepTypes, conversionMatrix, conversionTypes, toolsMatrix, toolsTypes, contentTypes)

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: Besides Sysrecon can visualize steps metabolic reconstruction, function vizProcess. addition, vizProcess also can generates output contains chemical-like steps.
code: text = paste0(inputTxt[,1], collapse = ' ')  vizProcess(text, stepsMatrix, stepTypes, contentTypes)

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: function vizTransformation function specifically visualizing transformation metabolic reconstruction.
code: text = paste0(inputTxt[,1], collapse = ' ')  vizTransformation(text, conversionMatrix, stepTypes, conversionTypes)

title: Systematical Metabolic Reconstruction
text: function vizTransformation function specifically visualizing databases tools used metabolic reconstruction.
code: text = paste0(inputTxt[,1], collapse = ' ')  vizTools(text, toolsMatrix, stepTypes, toolsTypes)

CMR 1 means output CMR. g2f 1 means output g2f.
